title: PHParray_pop()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHParray_pop()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Delete the last element of an array:
<?php
$a=array("red","green","blue");
array_pop($a);
print_r($a);
?>

Definition and Usage
The array_pop() function deletes the last element of an array.
Syntax
array_pop(
array
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
array
Required. Specifies an array
Technical Details
Return Value:
Returns the last value of
array
. If
array
is empty, or is not an array, NULL will be returned.
PHP Version:
4+

★
+1
